author: reshm
title: Fact Check for Cardano
description: 很难提炼出与Cardano有关的虚假信息，也没有一个简单的方法来做事实核查。

f6_assessments.q0: This project meets the expectations of the challenge in trying to create a system to fact-check and bring awareness of bad actors infiltrating the Cardano space.  This project in design is scalable to treat a variety of threats and build to enable fact-checking features that could be developed.
f6_assessments.q1: The project highlights a basic roadmap, targeted time for deliverables, and background on each team member.  This gives high confidence in the team understanding the scope of the proposed solution and their ability to deliver.
f6_assessments.q2: Given the amount of information around the proposal's timeline, deliverables, roadmap, and cost breakdown this proposal has, it is very transparent and auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a strong proposal that accurately addresses the objectives of the campaign. The solution perfectly fits the challenge because it will deliver a reliable way to establish if information about Cardano is true or not even for newcomers. This way transparency will be enhanced and the risk of having trust in the environment eroded is mitigated. The fact that there is currently no fact check website turned to the Cardano context adds even more potential to the project. Another important aspect to be mentioned is that the proposal meticulously articulates how it will add value to the Cardano environment by having this central place to resort to in case some controversial information arises. Also, the metrics discussed like number of facts verified, user activity on the website, requests for fact checking and number of community members registered are strongly aligned with the outlined challenge settings. Regarding the scalability of the project the proposers did not spend a lot of time on the topic, but the team claimed other funds could be used in case it was necessary.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal is highly likely to succeed. There is abundant evidence the team has the necessary skills and experience to accomplish the task being proposed. All the team members presented possess strong backgrounds and have been involved with Cardano related activities for some time. They clearly break down all the types of work that will be necessary during the project and the number of team members required is adequate. Moreover, the budget is reasonable to accomplish the targeted idea. The timetable designed is realistic and the milestones aimed during the implementation are sensible and identifiable. The proposers explain not only what will be done but also how when they break down each part of the proposal into smaller tasks, which is quite positive. However, relevant risks and challenges that might pop up during execution could have been more thoroughly discussed. In case additional funding is necessary to develop new features the team has considered new catalyst funding rounds or crowdfunding.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress of the project. The metrics defined are reasonable and quantifiable. Moreover, the KPIs designed are aligned with the objectives pursued and will help to keep track of how progress is evolving. The roadmap built is well structured and possess a reasonable time horizon. Also, a lengthy description of the problem was given, and the team has demonstrated they truly understand it and is confident their solution will address the problem. A suggestion I would add is to create a monthly report to update the interested parties updated about the project.

f6_assessments.q0: I once witnessed 2 very prominent Cardano Community twitter users block an IOG-ProjectCatalyst staff member for fact-checking their claims and thought it a sad day for our ecosystem. No one else challenged their claims because it may had been a feel-good sentiment. But we are Cardano, built on rigour and facts, not popular opinions. So reading this this proposal gives me hope that such incidents do not occur again or that more of our community members fact-check and challenge undue claims for the sake of clout & social algorithm. This proposal whilst asking for a low amount can bring tremendous value to our community and to other crypto participants who are not so in-tune with all things Cardano. If successfully funded and built, it would be an asset and due to this I whole-heartedly agree that it falls within the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team members are credentialed contributors to Cardano and often perform voluntarily. Their background outside of crypto seems to hold value and provides confidence this proposal is well within their remit and capabilities. As a CA I've personally utilised some of the tools Victor assisted in producing so I have first-hand experience in the quality of the work. Add to this the openness of the entire win win team and their bona fides and we have the recipe for a success. In terms of the plan, the 4-month road map is sound and actually aligns perfectly with the Cardano growth we expect to come following the release of the PAB and Atala PRISM, and this may well be the time when such a fact-checking site comes in handy. The success metrics and KPIs presented seem very achievable and I would not be surprised if surpassed. As a former assessor of university tenders and contracts, the necessary background of the people and the plan are presented to provide a high degree of confidence that success is achievable. Good luck.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has enough information to make it auditable and where I would suggest an improvement is in the explanation of how the achievements of the 3, 6 month targets. It would be good to know if the results of requirements gathering and other aspects such as the 'roles' in the system and the KPIs will be shared with the community. Given the relative closeness of some team members to Project Catalyst, I have confidence that asking questions or updates will be easy. But preferentially, it would have been good to have these mentioned on the proposal. Notwithstanding, this is a team embedded in all things Cardano, from Catalyst to Plutus and to Atala Prism. They are very reachable on multiple channels and are trusted members of the community that I agree there is a high degree of auditability and accountability in this proposal and I wish them well.
f6_assessments.reply: This assessment mentioned that we didn't provide any roadmap or timeline, but we described that the sessions would be completed within 12 weeks between February and April 2022. It also uses the same argument of horly cost of the tutors being high, but it disconsiders how difficult it is to find good instructors of Haskell within the Cardano ecosystem. Besides that, it uses the same argument in both auditability and feasibility criteria to justify the low score.

f6_assessments.q0: Solid idea and execution. By providing a Fact Check website everyone in the community would be able to see what the truth is. The website would deliver clarity and transparency from the community to the community. This proposal fits within the challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the team of this proposal, we get a sufficient amount of information to place our trust in them. They provide all the necessary details to show that they can bring this proposal to completion. They also say that they would hire members to make the website since none of them have the relevant skills to do so. The plan is well defined and gives insight on how the plan on providing the truth instead of misinformation. One thing I would shine some light on is how the fact-check requests are being handled. The proposal does not go into detail on this and I would propose a verification system like blockchain. All the fact-checkers must verify the to be published information so no malicious attack from inside is possible.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided is reasonable and gives a precise view of what the team plans to do. I did notice one thing misaligned in the roadmap and success metrics. In the success metrics, the proposers talk about 500 users registrations but in the roadmap there is a public launch in the fourth month. Unless they wish to have 500 registrations in the pilot launch, but this seems a bit extravagant.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well addressing the challenge and tracking disinformaiotn is an important issue. The problem is explained in details and the solution relates well to the problem and both provide a lot of clear details. Kind of a Wikipedia for Cardano. Sounds great and I will use it.
f6_assessments.q1:
Very solid and experienced team with relevant background, highly active in the community, and with a great track record. The informaiton about the team is well detailed. 

The budget is clearly outlined and reasonable and describes the resources necessary to implement the proposal. 
The timeframe and tasks seem well planned and the team understands the technical requirements and stages to build the initial platform.
f6_assessments.q2:
KPIs are clear and measurable including the users, facts published, and traction. There is a and understandable description of the first phase of the solution and it will address the problem and the challenge. 

It would have been helpful to get more information about the 6 and 12 months plans, to maintain and promote the platform, and evaluation of new development phases.  This is also relevant for the KPIs as you could have some 6-12 months estimations of published fact checks and users registrations. It will give more understanding of the scope and scale of the solution.  

There is a concern that more funds will be needed going forward as the system scale. You do mention donations, volunteers, and requests funds from the community for additional features. It might make sense to list those features and see what will be critical as the traction grows. 

Being involved in technology projects myself (as an entrepreneur and mentor) we many times say: "it takes double the time and double the funds to reach the results". From such an experienced team it would have been good to speak more about it as it is a potential challenge.
f6_assessments.reply: The CA mentiones that no roadmap or milestones were added to the proposal, but we explicitly mentioned that we will host 12 sessions between February and April 2022. Due the this proposal's simplicity, it doesn't required a detailed roadmap and also milestiones, since the implementation is quite straight forward: hosting the mentioned Haskell coding sessions.

f6_assessments.q0: Disinformation is a problem across various industries--social media and news being two notable examples. In order to counteract potential disinformation from entering the Cardano ecosystem, it is crucial to have a central hub with community members can go for information. This project works directly to accomplish this challenge's goal.
f6_assessments.q1: The extremely detailed overview of the founding team's qualifications, the KPIs, budget overview, and success metrics show that the team is likely to implement this project successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The fact that the team has outlined their KPIs and roadmap means that it will be straightforward for the community to tell if they have accomplished their promises on time.

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge since it wants to build up a fact-check website so that conspiracies, suspicious theories, falsehood, etc. can be easily checked and accessed. If this proposal is funded, I think it will contribute a great impact to Cardano community. Since people pop up so many questions on Telegram channel of Cardano and argue about what's is legitimate, I see a burden for admins to answer/ fix all of them. This fact check website could release that burden and somehow could build more trust to newcomers visiting around. Users can benefit from it to make right decisions.
f6_assessments.q1:
I think the team Loxe Inc. is so powerful and compatible to do run this project because its members are from Cardano/ Catalyst management, ambassador and funded proposers with high experience. And due to this point, they can divide the process of publishing fact into 2 phases: automated checks relying on the credentials of the publisher and manual checks by authorised personnel when automated checks cannot verify. If the idea of doing fact check was proposed by other teams, it would be hard to publish facts outside of the credentials source.  
Development plan, timeline, budget and resources are all clear. Therefore, I rate the feasibility for this proposal the highest score of 5.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provides me sufficient information to audit the progress and the success. Roadmap with very clear milestones, key metrics for success, yes. I rate 5 for auditability and hope that this proposal will be funded. Goodluck to team!

f6_assessments.q0: It is my understanding the proposal aims to create a community driven website as a hub for fact checking to combat disinformation around Cardano. The proposal is appropriate to the challenge of disinformation. I believe this proposal if implemented will have a positive impact of the cardano ecosystem. The proposal has outlined sustainability thoughtfulness further to the future of the platform itself the proposal could expand on how moderators will be encourage to the platform, road map to decentralised aspects of the platform or censorship resilience of the host infrastructure itself.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposals team looks to be very strong and more than sufficiently experienced to execute the proposal successfully. I say more than sufficient as it is my impression they could have furthered the intricacies and scope of the platform to include for example crawlers, api's and bot intergrations to seek common keywords for disinformation campaigns and directly refer them to the proposed platform of construction. Charlie_Cardano_Bot is one possible outlet.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has what i consider to be basic outcomes and KPI's statements with a fast pace delivery outline for public launch in May 2022.  I would have liked to see more detail in the outcomes/deliverable features of the platform. The preliminary research in platform features would  become a list of deliverable targets. The broad outcomes provided in the proposal are going to leave much room for interpretation in the auditability of the success of the proposal.
